elements.title: Abbey of Saint Winnoc (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that two towers remain (pictured) of the otherwise almost completely demolished Abbey of Saint Winnoc, because they were used as daymarks by sailors?

elements.title: Michael Owens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michael Owens became the first mayor of Mableton, Georgia, in more than 100 years after winning the 2023 mayoral election?

elements.title: Peckham Rock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Peckham Rock, a fake cave painting surreptitiously installed in the British Museum by Banksy, is actually concrete from Hackney?

elements.title: Susan Berget (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that biochemist Susan Berget was heavily involved in the discovery of split genes, but was excluded from credit and later the Nobel Prize for the research?

elements.title: Central Archives of Gaza City (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than 150 years of documentary sources at the Central Archives of Gaza City were destroyed during the Israel–Hamas war?

elements.title: the Oregon TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for 25 years after an attempt to explode a whale went awry, the Oregon TV station that filmed it regularly fielded requests for its footage?

elements.title: Acherontemys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the fossil turtle Acherontemys was named for a "river of the fabled lower world"?

elements.title: Tap Pryor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tap Pryor saw a coral reef in Zanzibar that inspired him to spend his life "under water"?
